alert.note: Alert for Delaware (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 08 at 9:41PM EDT until April 10 at 11:00PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in New York... East Branch Delaware At Harvard affecting Delaware County. For the East Branch Delaware River...including Harvard, Fishs Eddy... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE SUNDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...East Branch Delaware At Harvard. * WHEN...Until late Sunday evening. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Moderate Flood Stage. Between 12 and 15 feet, river flooding begins at the Oxbow Campground in Harvard. Significant backwater flooding from Baxter Brook is also likely. Residences along Harvard Road and Route 30 from Harvard to East Branch are threatened. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 PM EDT Friday the stage was 12.2 feet. - The river stage at Harvard crested at 12.6 feet between 2 PM and 3 PM. It has been falling since that time and will continue to do so overnight through Saturday night. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
